headline: Retail investors are 'optimistic,' but 'realistic' going into 2025
summary: Retail investors are feeling bullish about the market (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) in 2025, eToro's fourth quarter Retail Investor Beat shows. eToro investment analyst Bret Kenwell joins Josh Lipton and Seana Smith on Market Domination to discuss how retail investors are thinking about the market headed into the new year. Kenwell says retail investors are "optimistic" but "realistic" for the new year. "They're looking to gain more exposure to crypto in 2025. They're looking to gain more exposure to equities in 2025. But they're also looking to raise some cash here," he says, later adding: "I think they're being prudent, but also, you know, keeping one foot in at least is so they keep getting taking advantage of, you know, more gains to come in 2025 if that is the case." The analyst reports that the survey found retail investors to prefer the financials sector and big-cap tech, including Magnificent Seven names and other artificial intelligence (AI) plays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: "Real-world AI" is the next phase of this tech: Portfolio mgr.
summary: Nightview Capital portfolio manager Dan Crowley discusses the transformative potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in 2025 on Market Domination Overtime. "We think we're headed toward a period of rapid technological shifts. Historically, whenever that's happened, significant opportunities have been unlocked," Crowley explains. He believes AI's economic impact could rival that of the internet revolution. Crowley identifies "real-world AI" as the sector's next evolution, highlighting two key investment opportunities. First, he points to "entirely new product-category" companies like Tesla (TSLA), which is advancing autonomous driving technology. Second, he sees potential in established companies with "existing business lines," such as Amazon (AMZN), which can leverage AI to enhance operational efficiency. "We're kind of trying to move into the next phase here of where we see AI playing out," he tells Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Why Broadcom Was Rallying Again Today
summary: Shares of Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) rallied 5.3% on Monday, as of 1:18 p.m. ET.  Broadcom received a bullish note and price target upgrade from a Wall Street sell-side analyst today, building upon the blowout 2027 guidance management gave on the company's recent earnings call.  On Monday, UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri raised his target on Broadcom from $220 to $270 per share, while maintaining his bullish stance on the name.

On Monday, UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri raised his target on Broadcom from $220 to $270 per share, while maintaining his bullish stance on the name.

headline: CFPB vs. Walmart, iPhone 16, Apollo and Workday: Top Stocks
summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is suing retailer Walmart (WMT) for forcing its delivery drivers to use pricey deposit accounts in order to receive payments. Wedbush senior analyst Dan Ives published a note stating that the global demand for Apple's iPhone 16 (AAPL) has increased slightly above expectations. Apollo Global Management (APO) and Workday (WDAY) have begun trading on the S&P 500 (^GSPC) on Monday. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Apple Stock Edges Up. How the iPhone 16 Could Send It Even Higher.
summary: Apple  biggest supporter is predicting a powerful end to 2024, driven by robust iPhone sales during Christmas, setting the stage for the tech company to hit a $4 trillion market value.  In a note on Monday, Wedbush’s Daniel Ives wrote that he believes Apple is set to have a strong holiday season as iPhone 16 upgrades are trending well as Christmas nears, based on recent checks of supply chains in Asia.  Currently, 100 million iPhones in China alone could be upgraded, or replaced with newer devices, in 2025, Ives estimates.

headline: Warren Buffett Recently Shunned His Favorite Stock for the First Time Since 2018, and It Could Spell Bad News for Wall Street
summary: It was 1965 when Warren Buffett became the CEO of Berkshire.  Berkshire is also sitting on $325 billion in cash, which Buffett and his team can put to work when they spot new opportunities.  According to the conglomerate's 13-F filings, he is on a major selling spree in 2024.

headline: History Says the Nasdaq Could See Strong Gains in 2025: Here Are the Top Nasdaq Stocks From Warren Buffett and Bill Ackman Going Into the New Year
summary: The stock market is so hot that I'm struggling to wrap my mind around the numbers.  As of this writing, the Nasdaq Composite Index (NASDAQINDEX: ^IXIC) is up 30% in 2024.  According to MacroTrends, the Nasdaq Composite Index has gone up by 30% or more in 13 other years since 1972 (the index's first full year).

headline: Why You Should Not Trade Apple Stock Like You're Warren Buffett
summary: Despite a rapidly changing tech landscape, few investors are likely to dispute the assertion that Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock will remain a long-term winner.  While its artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities may not receive as much attention as those of Nvidia or Palantir, its massive resources, improving technology, and customer loyalty will likely keep the company a major force in its industry for some time to come.  Knowing those attributes, investors may have trouble reconciling the investment case for Apple, considering that Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B) sold a large chunk of its shares.
